item.description: All of my writing happens in iAWriter. All of my editing is happening in the Hemingway app. If youâ€™ve not used this app, go read the help section first then give it a try on something youâ€™ve written. Itâ€™s eye-opening.

As much as I love October, really glad itâ€™s finally over and can look forward to what November has to bring. Winter is finally upon us and Iâ€™m looking forward to enjoying the outdoors a little bit more. With both boys in tow Iâ€™m hoping for a bunch of fun over the next 6 months.

First proper halloween experience for Zane, which he absolutely loved. Got dressed as a pterodactyl, hunted for houses with their lights on and then stuffing his bucket with goodies. Iâ€™ve never been into Halloween, but starting to enjoy it through my kidâ€™s eyes.

This new iPad Pro is a great way to finally get into the iPad lifestyle. Glad I waited out for this version (rather than getting one last year). Hopefully itâ€™ll be my upgraded computing device for the next five years.
If youâ€™re looking for a great alternative to the standard Apple case for your iPhone 6, 6s, 7 and 8, look no further than the Puro Icon case. Got mine in an amazing aquamarine colour.

If youâ€™re struggling to write on your site, then consider a trick Iâ€™ve been using this year. I write for myself and 1 other person that doesnâ€™t exist, except in my mind. He likes similar things as me, and my site is how I share small messages with him.
Inktober #005 continues.
Inktober is nearly over. This one was done while I was on the phone.

Went to the Big Bad Wold book fair (the biggest of itâ€™s kind in the world). Itâ€™s so massive that people wander around with supermarket shopping carts filled will books. For my first trip I picked up:

  1. Graphic Ink by Frank Quietley
  2. The Wake by Scott Snyder and Sean Murphy
  3. Comics A Global History by Dan Mazur and Alexander Danner
ðŸ“š Autumn reading. Second Ryan Holiday book this year. I still need to write the notes from my previous two books. Maybe this week.

Youâ€™re testing me Apple. Iâ€™ve abstained from your iPhone ploy this year (even though Iâ€™m sporting an iPhone 6S), but Iâ€™ve never owned an iPad and Iâ€™m running a 5 year old Macbook Pro, which is closing in on upgrade territory.

If youâ€™re looking to create something, anything really, then I seriously encourage you to listen to Seth Godinâ€™s podcast Akimbo. The previous episode, Youâ€™re it seriously captures the reason that you should start NOW with that endeavour. Donâ€™t wait. Youâ€™re wasting time. As am I.
Operation start using your iPhone less and take your Sony mirrorless camera everywhere is beginning to pay some dividends.
Discovered Burro Blanco in Abu Dhabi a couple of weeks ago. By far my favourite Mexican restaurant in the UAE.
Definitely considering backing this chopstick set. The straw might now be as useful for me, but I really like the chopsticks rest and pouch. Super neat solution.
Jan Middendorpâ€™s Dutch Type is truly a magnificent book. I would go so far as to call it the best looking book on typography that I own. If you can get a copy, donâ€™t hesitate. Gorgeous.
Final Inktober image for today.
The constraint for Inktober this year is the number of pens Iâ€™m using and the size of paper, which are these super cheap postcards from Muji (12 for less than a dollar).
I know Iâ€™m super late to Inktober this year, but better late than never.
I can finally declare Autumn/Winter has begun here in Dubai. Itâ€™s been a really long summer so hoping to make full advantage of the good weather this year.

My wife is forever loosing her iPhone. Top tip. If you login from another device on iCloud (and assuming the phone is still got power and connected to the internet) you can cause it to ring, even if itâ€™s put on mute. So awesome.

item.title: Phones and Cameras
item.description:
After listen to The Minimalists on the Kevin Rose show, I came to a realisation. In my persuit to determine which iPhone I should be buying this year, it turns out I really donâ€™t need to get one after all.

The reason for upgrading isnâ€™t because the phone is slow, lacks some essential feature or that certain apps donâ€™t run on it. Rather the only reason to upgrade is for the camera.

Except I already own a pretty decent camera, the NEX-F3. I bought it just before Zane was born (so a little over 4 years ago now) and seem to have stopped using it 2 years ago. Why? Iâ€™m not sure. Maybe I bought into the whole â€˜the best camera is the one on youâ€™ ideaology?

A quick read of a Wirecutter article I bookmarked in 2013, led me to circling onto several Sigma lens that will help me get better photos. The bonus to all this is that theyâ€™re at a pretty reduced price point at the moment. And while weâ€™re here, we might as well talk about one of my favourite article about photography to brush up on some things.

Netflix has seriously changed how I consume some of my entertainment. Thankfully Better Call Saul isnâ€™t on that network which means I have to wait for a new episode every week. Somehow gives my week a little bit of relief as itâ€™s the only show Iâ€™m watching these days.

I stumbled upon a truly incredible graph today that showed all the various types of Photovoltaic panel technology and their efficiency progress mapped across the years. Whatâ€™s astounding is the innovation that is happening in this space, showing where the future will be.
Happy Inktober everyone. Iâ€™m hoping to dip my toe this year and have an idea of what to do, hopefully ready with a few things to share.

Everything old is new again. New faces in the office as our team slowly continues itâ€™s transformation. Iâ€™m obviously aware (sometimes painfully) that nothing in life stays the same. When life kicks your ass, first tidy everything up and then assess and review.

Finally got the bluetooth in my car sorted out. Itâ€™s only taken a couple of years and $100 to get it sorted. Iâ€™ll never understand why Audi donâ€™t enable this simple feature to begin with but there you have it. Now I can listen to my tunes through proper speakers.
Itâ€™s getting easier to draw these scenes. The funny thing being that once I gave up on drawing comics Iâ€™ve allowed myself to draw these types of things.

Ok Iâ€™ve not bought any new Field Notes in a year. I still have a healthy stash and could easily remain stocked up for several years to comeâ€¦.however these Ram edition are really testing my Field Notes abstinence.
These three F1 2021 concepts as revealed on the F1 website show a future of motosport that looks exciting. Theyâ€™re also meant delivers to deliver closer driving and wheel to wheel action.

Rough couple of days. Zane caught something from school, which he gave to me, which I gave to the wife. The joys of a new school year I guess and all the delightful viruses that are given the opportunity to jump from one child to the other. Good news is itâ€™s nearly over.
Not one but two great additions to iAWriter. Which reminds me that I need to take a deep dive into the Shortcuts app as soon as possible.
Complet-ish but un-used art for my upcoming project. It was too busy for what Iâ€™m going for.
My favourite feeling these days is that moment I step into the house, after work, and my boy Ryan is genuinely happy and excited to see me. It never lasts very long so Iâ€™m cherishing these moments.
Was hoping to get the Hobonichi Weeks Mega this year. Sadly out of stock, 17 days after launch!

So when we bought the Q5 2 1/2 years ago what I didnâ€™t realise was that although bluetooth was available in the car, Audi had decided that it would restrict where. Specifically music couldnâ€™t stream that way. Itâ€™s taken me this long to resolve the issue with an overpriced dingus.

Following up from my previous post, sometimes you need some bad sleep for you to work out whatâ€™s already in your head. Ryan decided not to sleep tonight, but my brain kicked into overdrive this morning and Iâ€™ve settled on the style Iâ€™m trying to achieve. LOTS of art to come!

Well that didnâ€™t go as planned. Iâ€™ve been working on a piece of art for my new project all weekend and completed 85%. When I finally had a look at it in itâ€™s intended medium (email), I realised it was too busy and complicated. Back to the drawing board I guess.
Because one sketch deserves anotherâ€¦
More sketches.
Itâ€™s iPhone X, or iPhone XS day! After 4 years I think Iâ€™m finally due for an upgrade.
First attempt at using my new style with architectural style backgrounds - always the intention really.
Learning how to draw and sketch in ways different to what Iâ€™m used to. First up, cars!

Fell down a massive hole that is Udemy. Never heard of it before and stumbled on it by accident while looking for resources for sketching like an architect. Found a great course and then proceeded to buy a whole bunch more.

ðŸŽ¥ So the wife and I finally watched a movie together. We settled on Tully. Great movie. It will hit different people in different ways. It hit my wife the hardest being a mother of a 4 year old and 8 month old. Diablo Codi is one of my favourite writers in Hollywood.

ðŸ‡¯ðŸ‡µ Hadnâ€™t realised the extent of the destruction on Japan this summer. I have a huge soft spot in my mind and heart for the country. I truly wish them the best in what seems to be a never ending assault of natural disasters.

So the new upload function on Micro.blog is pretty awesome. Especially considering it works for gifs as well. The new Maus from Lofree is another design win from a company whoâ€™s really been killing it as bringing 1950s stylings to modern technology.
So I discovered Tadama today. Probably the most elegant and simple pomodoro app on the Mac.
